Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Sclerotherapy and Intralesional Excision for Aneurysmal Bone Cysts

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 94 patients with aneurysmal bone cysts were randomly assigned to two groups

Intervention.evidence: Group 1 received sclerotherapy, and Group 2 underwent intralesional excision and bone grafting

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of percutaneous repetitive sclerotherapy using polidocanol versus intralesional excision

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the healing rate, assessed over a minimum follow-up of 3.2 years

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments

Number_Randomised.evidence: 94 patients with aneurysmal bone cysts were randomly assigned to two groups

Number_Analysed.evidence: Ninety-one patients were analysed (45 in Group 1 and 46 in Group 2) using an intention-to-treat approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: Healing was achieved in 93.3% of Group 1 and 84.8% of Group 2

Harms.evidence: Group 1 experienced minor complications, while Group 2 had three deep infections, five superficial infections, and two growth disturbances
